results.title: T.V. commercials: Mobil circle of safety
results.creator_credit: George Patterson Creative Group and Mobil Oil Australia
results.brief_description: A series of television commercials made with the aim of promoting road safety and advertising the mechanical safety services available from the Mobil service stations. The nine commercials include: Swinging tyres, Traffic trauma, Eye, Cannonball, Queue, Go back, Cosmos, Belt up and Playground. Intellegent copy and strong images reinforce the message as well as the oil company’s logo.

results.title: T for teacher
results.brief_description: A cartoon all about a cup of tea, telling in amusing rhymes and sketches, how not to make a cup of tea, and some simple rules for making a good “cuppa”.

results.title: Syrinx
results.brief_description: She was the nymph who found refuge in the river reeds when the goat-god Pan pursued her. Syrinx is the first film of Ryan Larkin, a young artist from Norman McLaren’s student group. To illustrate the ancient Greek legend of how Pan made his pipes, he employs various charcoal sketches. Accompanying music is Claude Debussy’s Syrinx for solo flute. (Awards: Addis Ababa, San Francisco, Montreal, Philadelphia)

constellations_primary.name: Cities under siege
constellations_primary.description: The Syrian Civil War is an ongoing conflict that is arguably the most documented in history, with images and videos captured by journalists, activists, combatants and victims.

results.title: Synthetic fibers: nylon and rayon
results.brief_description: Illustrates how modern science and technology have made possible the development of new artificial fibres for making textiles - especially rayon and nylon. Shows some of the processes used in making these fibres, some of the ways in which they are useful to society and some of the characteristics of the textiles made from them.

results.title: Synchronised swimming
results.brief_description: Synchronised swimming is dancing adapted to water - alone, with a partner, or in teams. Various arm and leg strokes are shown, both on the front and back; sculling in various ways is demonstrated, and rolling and rotating movements are seen. A team of four put this knowledge into practice with a demonstration to music.

results.title: Synchromy = Synchromie
results.brief_description: Here are pyrotechnics of the keyboard, but with only a camera to “play the tune.” To make this film, Norman McLaren employed novel optical techniques to compose the piano rhythms of the sound track. These he then moved, in multicolour, onto the picture area of the screen so that, in effect, you see what you hear. It is synchronisation of image and sound in the truest sense of the word. (Eight awards, including San Francisco; Barcelona; Melbourne.)

results.title: Symphony of life
results.creator_credit: N. Shantaram and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: Initiating a new trend in films produced by Documentary Films of India, “Symphony of Life” is a blend of music and image without spoken commentary. Through the visuals, the film brings into focus the most immediate and significant theme of our time - the struggle and the triumph of man over the destructive forces of nature and our hopes and aspirations for a better tomorrow. Musical score by V. Shirali, recorded by P. K. Vishwanath. Images by T. A. Abraham edited by N. D. Keluskar.
